title: Establishing common standards and curation practices: towards real world biosharing.
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: Curation/annotation practices will increase effectiveness of data sharing and reuse Agriculture, Food and Drink,Digital/Communication/Information Technologies (including Software),Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology Cultural,Policy & public services
findingsText: We have improved and refined our curation/annotation practices for omics datasets, especially for metagenomics and metabolomics datasets. Curation/annotation practices are generally useful guidelines for the data scientists and other service providers in both academia and industrial settings. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Digital/Communication/Information Technologies (including Software),Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
